output.csv

Class CSVWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • output.csv.CSVWriter

  • public class CSVWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    A CSVWriter-object writes text in a (csv-)file. It is possible to set the directory, the delimiter and the file extension via methods.
    Author:
    Florian Arfert, Christian Gläser

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSVWriter()
      Constructor with default arguments.

      Constructor with option to create a directory, if nonexistent.
      CSVWriter(java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String fileExtension, java.lang.String csvDelimiter)
      Constructor, which creates the directory, if nonexistent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVWriter

        public CSVWriter()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor with default arguments.

        Default directory: CSVfiles
        Default file extension: csv
        Default delimiter: ;

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if it is not possible to create the directory.
        See Also:
        CSVWriter(String directory, String fileExtension, String csvDelimiter), CSVWriter(String directory, boolean createDir, String fileExtension, String csvDelimiter)

      • CSVWriter

        public CSVWriter(java.lang.String directory,
                 java.lang.String fileExtension,
                 java.lang.String csvDelimiter)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor, which creates the directory, if nonexistent.
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory, where files are created.
        fileExtension - Extension of files.
        csvDelimiter - Delimiter between the data in a file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if it is not possible to create the directory.
        See Also:
        CSVWriter(String directory, boolean createDir, String fileExtension, String csvDelimiter)

      • CSVWriter

        public CSVWriter(java.lang.String directory,
                 boolean createDir,
                 java.lang.String fileExtension,
                 java.lang.String csvDelimiter)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor with option to create a directory, if nonexistent.

        Important
        If a directory is nonexistent all methods to create files will throw an IO-Exception.

        Parameters:
        directory - Directory, where files are created.
        createDir - true, if directory shall be created. Else false.
        fileExtension - Extension of files.
        csvDelimiter - Delimiter between the data in a file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if it is not possible to create the directory.

      • setDirectory

        public void setDirectory(java.lang.String path,
                         boolean createIfNonexistent)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the directry. It is possible to create the directory, if nonexistent, via setting the argument for "createIfNonexistent" to true.
        Parameters:
        path - Path for the directory.
        createIfNonexistent - True, if the directory shall be create if nonexistent. Else false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the path can't be resolved.

      • getDirectory

        public java.lang.String getDirectory()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the current directory.
        Returns:
        String with canonical path of the directory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if directory is not set or not correct.

      • createBillsAsCSV

        public void createBillsAsCSV(java.util.List<Bill> listOfBills)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the bills in a list as files in the specified directory. For more information createBillAsCSV(Bill).
        Parameters:
        listOfBills - List of bills.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error occurred during execution...
        See Also:
        createBillAsCSV(Bill)

      • createBillAsCSV

        public void createBillAsCSV(Bill bill)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a single bill in the specified directory. Every bill is stored as a file consisting of a name, which is the same as the invoice number. The file contains the invoice number, the billing date, the relevant posting text and the billing amount.
        If the file already exists, the file won't be created again.
        Parameters:
        bill - The bill, which shall be written as csv.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error occurred during execution...
